alert.note: Alert for St. Clair; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 22 at 2:23PM CST until February 22 at 3:30PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CST FOR WESTERN CLINTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BOND COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS...EAST CENTRAL MONROE AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS... At 222 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Troy to near Lebanon to Freeburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Jacob, Highland, New Baden, St. Rose, New Memphis, Trenton, Albers, Pocahontas, Jamestown, Aviston, Germantown, Breese and Beckemeyer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 30 and 36. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 12 and 41. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
